imp.core.commands.joints

Class BaseJointCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • imp.core.commands.joints.BaseJointCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CylinderCommand, PrismCommand, RevoluteCommand

    public abstract class BaseJointCommand
extends java.lang.Object
implements Command
    These is for joint commands only since this is the BaseJointCommand class. In theory if this needed to be synchronized up with a GUI the front end could iterate through commands taken from the command holder and look for those where instanceof BaseJointCommand.class returns true and then cast those commands to this class and then grab the necessary data. The fields within this class mark the strings used within the Map getDataFields(). These will be used to designate what strings to call to get each of the properties that all joints have: a joint name a body before a body after an origin extra data fields To see more information see the javadoc associated with each field

      static java.lang.String TYPE_FIELD
      This is the field property for the joint type it will return a String value when used with the dataFields map

      • DATA_FIELD

        public static final java.lang.String DATA_FIELD
        This is the property for extra data This field is the only unkown from the this abstract class. The data that will be returned is up to the class that extends this to fill in. By default this is actually not added into the map.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseJointCommand

        public BaseJointCommand(java.lang.String jointName,
                java.lang.String bodyNameBefore,
                java.lang.String bodyNameAfter,
                Point origin,
                java.lang.String type)
                 throws SelfLoopException
        General definition for definition commands. It implements the command used to create a * joint to link together two bodies.
        Parameters:
        jointName - The name of the joint.
        bodyNameAfter - The body after the joint.
        bodyNameBefore - The body before the joint.
        Throws:
        NullParameterException - Thrown if any parameters are null.
        SelfLoopException - Thrown if the command attempts to create a joint linking a body to itself.
